statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

article.description: Justin Johnson had his fifth-straight double-double with 19 points and 12 rebounds to lead Western Kentucky to a 79-62 win over Boston College on Tuesday night in a first-round game of the NIT.

video.headline: Thompson flushes it for WKU
video.caption: Darius Thompson cocks back and throws it down with one hand as Western Kentucky starts to pull away from Boston College.
video.description: Darius Thompson cocks back and throws it down with one hand as Western Kentucky starts to pull away from Boston College.
video.title: Thompson flushes it for WKU

article.headline: Johnson sparks Western Kentucky past BC 79-62 in NIT opener

images.name: Thompson flushes it for WKU
images.caption: Darius Thompson cocks back and throws it down with one hand as Western Kentucky starts to pull away from Boston College.

article.linkText: Johnson sparks Western Kentucky past BC 79-62 in NIT opener
article.story: BOWLING GREEN, Ky. -- Justin Johnson had his fifth-straight double-double with 19 points and 12 rebounds to lead Western Kentucky to a 79-62 win over Boston College on Tuesday night in a first-round game of the NIT. Taveion Hollingsworth added 18 points, five rebounds, four assists and three steals for the Hilltoppers (25-10), a four-seed. Darius Thompson had 17 points, eight assists and six rebounds. Boston College (19-16), a five seed, had an early 9-0 and used that to lead 24-19 after the first quarter. An early 7-0 burst, followed by a 9-0 run helped the Hilltoppers open a 41-33 halftime lead. Johnson had back-to-back dunks and Thompson added another to give WKU a 50-37 lead midway through the third quarter. The Eagles followed with consecutive baskets but Thompson matched that and Western Kentucky led the rest of the way. Ky Bowman had 18 points and Jerome Robinson 17 for the Eagles, who shot 38.5 percent compared to 55 percent for WKU. The only other meeting was a WKU win in Dec. 1982. BC coach Jim Christian was an assistant coach at WKU from 1990-92 under Ralph Willard.

videos.headline: Johnson gets rejection at the rim
videos.description: Justin Johnson comes up with a big block for Western Kentucky against Boston College.

videos.headline: Bowman throws it down in transition
videos.description: Ky Bowman elevates and slams it home for Boston College on the fast break.
